Human resources and skills development Canada
full_summary:
### Office Seating Purchase and Delivery for Manitoba Region

#### Notice of Proposal Request

Employment and Social Development Canada is seeking proposals for the purchase and delivery of office seating to the Winnipeg, Manitoba region. The procurement is set aside under the federal government's Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Business.

#### Tender Details

* Reference Number: cb-181-525393
* Solicitation Number: 100024854
* Tender Closing Date: 2023-12-06T14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2023-12-20
* Expected Contract End Date: 2024-03-01
* Regions of Delivery: Manitoba, Canada
* Tender Status: Expired

#### Procurement Category

* Procurement Category: Goods and Services (GD)
* Procurement Method: Competitive - Selective Tendering
* Trade Agreements: None

#### Goods and Services

* UNSPSC Category: Office furniture (56101700)
* Goods and Services Required: Rotary chairs, Rotary stools, Rotary Guest Chair, Side chairs

#### Pre-Qualification Requirements

* Suppliers must be pre-qualified and have been issued a Supply Arrangement (SA) to be eligible to bid.
* Non-SA holders may submit a bid to the Identified User (IU) but must also submit an arrangement to the Supply Arrangement Authority (SAA) for evaluation.

#### Contact Information

* Name: Kimberly Hutchings
* Email: NC-SOLICITATIONS-GD@hrsdc-rhdcc.gc.ca
* Phone: (819) 360-6740
* Fax: None

#### PROCUREMENT DOCUMENTS

The procurement documents are available for download from the Canada Buys website.

Note: I rewrote and rephrased the text to make it more professional. I also ensured that the rewritten entry is concise and within the 400-word limit. I omitted some of the extraneous details and reorganized the information for better clarity and readability. 

Please let me know if there are any additional changes you would like me to make! 

Here are some specific changes I made:

1. Properly formatted the notice of proposal request section, including the tender details and procurement category.
2. Simplified the procurement category and procurement method sections to make them more clear and concise.
3. Separated the goods and services section into two distinct points to improve readability.
4. Removed the outdated information from the attachment section.
5. Provided a clear and concise summary of the pre-qualification requirements
